title: Which warrior wielded the heaviest sword? - Quora

response.answer_text: That would most likely be the Landsknecht, more specifically the Doppelsöldner ones wielding Zweihänders.  Landsknecht were a type of mercenary in 15th- and 16th- century Europe. Doppelsöldner were literally "double pay"-men, either the volunteers who fought in the front rank of the formation for better wages or the  more experienced specialists. One subcategory of the Doppelsöldner were the ones wielding Zweihänders, swords which could be up to 180cm (6ft) long and weigh 2-3.2kg (4.4-7.1 lb). These were used to guard the standard bearer of the unit, and according to some accounts also as the first rank of a pike unit in order to attack the spears or pikes of an enemy unit. I've heard this from multiple sources and having handled both types of weapons, it makes quite a bit of sense. There seems to be historical accounts of the story as well, but as they are of a later date than the actual use of the weapons, it cannot be verified. It can, however, be said for a fair degree of certainty that the Zweihänder was a weapon meant primarily for unit warfare and a specific role rather than being the optimal tool for all your needs in personal combat.

THE RAJPUTANA The Great Hindu Rajput King Maharana Pratap use to carry two swords 25 kg each. Before fight he used to offer one sword to his opponent if he is not armed. Total weight of Maharana’s armor, bhala, shield and his two swords = 206 kg. He was 7 feet 5 inches tall. The Rana Pratap was born at Kumbhalgarh on Sunday the May 9, 1540 to The Hindu Rajput King Maharana Udai Singh II and Queen Maharani Javanta Bai Songara (Chauhan clan of Hindu Rajputs). Pratap was eldest of 25 brothers and 20 sisters. Most important of Maharana Pratap Singhs legacy was in the military field - after War of haldighati, he increasingly experimented and perfected guerrilla warfare and light horse tactics. His innovative military strategy is still in practise among Indian army regiments.
